alert.note: Alert for Arlington, Falls Church, Alexandria (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 30 at 5:42AM EST until January 31 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in the City of Alexandria and Arlington County. * WHEN...Until 3 AM EST Wednesday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...Water is expected to approach the curb near the intersection of King Street and Strand Street in Alexandria. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides one and a half to two feet above normal. The next two high tides at Alexandria are at 11:22 AM this morning and 11:40 PM this evening.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
